summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an attorney named Don, attaching a grand jury subpoena for Michael Davis and proposing to adjourn the return date to August 30, 2019, to allow time for consultation.

persons.name: Michael Davis
persons.context: Individual who is being subpoenaed to appear before a grand jury; the prosecutor is seeking to meet with him.

persons.name: Don
persons.context: Attorney being contacted by the prosecutor regarding his client, Michael Davis, and the attached grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email from the Southern District of New York, who is issuing a grand jury subpoena for Michael Davis and coordinating with his attorney.

connections.description: Don is the attorney representing Michael Davis, as indicated by the prosecutor's reference to allowing time 'to meet with your client.'
The prosecutor is issuing a grand jury subpoena to Michael Davis, indicating he is a subject or witness in a federal investigation.
Professional correspondence between a federal prosecutor and a defense attorney regarding scheduling and legal process for the attorney's client.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Michael Davis
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued for Michael Davis, as indicated by the attached PDF file named '2019.08.15_Michael_Davis_Subpoena.pdf'.

events.title: Proposed Adjourned Return Date for Subpoena
events.description: The prosecutor proposes adjourning the return date for Michael Davis's grand jury subpoena to August 30, 2019, to allow his attorney time to consult with him.

keyFacts: A federal prosecutor from the SDNY issued a grand jury subpoena to an individual named Michael Davis in August 2019.
The prosecutor was coordinating with Michael Davis's attorney, Don, to schedule his appearance and was willing to grant an adjournment.
This document indicates an active federal grand jury investigation related to the Epstein case was ongoing as of August 2019.
